x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
A huge portion of the workforce in many developing countries operate informally; artisans, riders, tailors, market traders, domestic workers, and freelancers.
They rely on word-of-mouth for jobs, lack verified work histories, and have no structured way to build trust with employers or clients. Without formal records or references, they struggle to access better jobs, training, or credit facilities.
At the same time, small businesses and households constantly search for reliable skilled workers but have no transparent way to verify competence or past performance.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: WorkNow: AI-Powered Job Tracker and Opportunity Connector for Informal/Skilled Workers
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

App Engine / Studio: to design custom tables for worker profiles, job history, ratings, and client reviews.

Flow Designer: automates matching, recommendations, and alerts for new job listings that fit a worker’s skill or region.

AI Search & Predictive Intelligence: learns user preferences to suggest verified workers or new opportunities.

Service Portal / Experience Sites: serves as the front-end where users create profiles, log jobs, or find talent.

Mobile App: lets workers update availability, log completed jobs, and receive new offers in real time.

IntegrationHub: connects to existing job boards, WhatsApp Business APIs, or micro-finance partners for credit opportunities.

Performance Analytics: tracks job placements, user growth, and impact metrics (income improvements, engagement rate).

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

SMS/USSD Integration: ensures accessibility for low-end phone users.

Identity Verification API (e.g., NIN, BVN, or third-party KYC): validates worker authenticity.

AI Model for Scoring: trained on user activity, client ratings, and reliability patterns.

Third-party job data feeds: for aggregating external opportunities.

Geolocation APIs: to match workers and clients within proximity.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Data Trust: Ensuring fairness and privacy in AI scoring models.

Verification: Balancing simplicity with authenticity for informal workers who may lack formal IDs.

Adoption: Encouraging consistent use among users with limited tech familiarity.

Connectivity Gaps: Providing low-data modes for rural or low-bandwidth regions.

Partnerships: Securing cooperation from micro-finance and skill-development bodies for full ecosystem impact.
